intro: Pellionia daveauana var. viridis, commonly known as the green-stemmed Pellionia, is a tropical flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that are typically borne on inflorescences. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental foliage. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for indoor gardening and botanical collections.
